story.iWant: To measure caller personality traits using the Big Five (OCEAN) model
story.soThat: I can adapt my communication style to match each caller's personality profile

context.applies: All voice conversations - personality assessment runs continuously
assumptions: Sufficient conversational turns to establish trait patterns
Caller is speaking naturally without scripted responses
Audio quality allows for prosodic analysis

acceptanceCriteria.title: Openness trait detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: A caller engaged in conversation with varied topics
acceptanceCriteria.when: The system analyzes linguistic creativity and abstract thinking markers
acceptanceCriteria.then: An Openness score between 0-1 is produced
acceptanceCriteria.rationale: Openness affects how much novelty and complexity a caller can handle

acceptanceCriteria.title: Conscientiousness trait detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: A caller discussing plans, decisions, or processes
acceptanceCriteria.when: The system analyzes organization and detail-orientation markers
acceptanceCriteria.then: A Conscientiousness score between 0-1 is produced
acceptanceCriteria.rationale: Conscientiousness affects how much structure and detail callers prefer

acceptanceCriteria.title: Extraversion trait detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: A caller with measurable conversational energy and engagement
acceptanceCriteria.when: The system analyzes speech patterns and social engagement markers
acceptanceCriteria.then: An Extraversion score between 0-1 is produced
acceptanceCriteria.rationale: Extraversion affects conversation pacing and social interaction style

acceptanceCriteria.title: Agreeableness trait detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: A caller interacting with the agent on decisions or recommendations
acceptanceCriteria.when: The system analyzes cooperation and conflict-handling markers
acceptanceCriteria.then: An Agreeableness score between 0-1 is produced
acceptanceCriteria.rationale: Agreeableness affects how to frame recommendations and handle objections

acceptanceCriteria.title: Neuroticism trait detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: A caller in various emotional states during conversation
acceptanceCriteria.when: The system analyzes emotional stability markers
acceptanceCriteria.then: A Neuroticism score between 0-1 is produced
acceptanceCriteria.rationale: Neuroticism affects how to handle stress and provide reassurance

constraints.description: Personality scores must correlate with validated Big Five instruments at r >= 0.6
Trait scores should stabilize after 3-5 conversational turns and not fluctuate wildly
Personality data must not be used for discriminatory purposes or shared externally

failureConditions.implication: Not enough words to assess personality - use neutral defaults

parameters.name: openness
parameters.description: Openness to Experience - intellectual curiosity, creativity, preference for novelty and variety

subMetrics.name: Vocabulary Diversity
subMetrics.description: Range and sophistication of word choices

definitions.high: Uses varied, sophisticated vocabulary; employs metaphors and abstract concepts
definitions.low: Relies on common words; concrete, literal language; avoids abstractions

subMetrics.name: Abstract Language Use
subMetrics.description: Preference for abstract vs concrete concepts

definitions.high: Discusses ideas, possibilities, hypotheticals; comfortable with ambiguity
definitions.low: Focuses on facts, specifics, practical matters; wants concrete answers

subMetrics.name: Curiosity Markers
subMetrics.description: Questions and interest in understanding beyond immediate needs

definitions.high: Asks 'why' and 'how' questions; explores tangents; interested in context
definitions.low: Asks only necessary questions; stays on topic; wants direct answers

interpretationScale.label: Traditional/Practical
interpretationScale.implication: Prefers familiar approaches, concrete information, proven methods

interpretationScale.label: Balanced
interpretationScale.implication: Moderate openness - can handle some novelty but appreciates practicality

interpretationScale.label: Curious
interpretationScale.implication: Enjoys learning new things, open to different perspectives

interpretationScale.label: Highly Open
interpretationScale.implication: Seeks novelty, abstract thinker, creative problem-solver

scoringAnchors.example: Just tell me what I need to do. I don't need to know why, just the steps.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Avoids abstract discussion, wants only practical action items, no curiosity about underlying reasons

scoringAnchors.example: Okay, that makes sense. Is there anything else I should know about this?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Accepts information, asks functional follow-up but doesn't explore deeply

scoringAnchors.example: That's interesting - so how does that compare to how it used to work? I'm curious about the change.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Shows genuine curiosity, asks comparative questions, interested in context

scoringAnchors.example: Fascinating! So if I understand the underlying principle correctly, this could also apply to other situations where... let me think through this...
scoringAnchors.rationale: Abstract thinking, generalizes concepts, actively engages with ideas

scoringAnchors.example: This reminds me of a concept I read about - the interconnectedness of these systems is remarkable. What if we approached it from a completely different angle, like thinking about it metaphorically as a living ecosystem?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Highly abstract, uses metaphors, explores unconventional perspectives, intellectually engaged

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This caller is intellectually curious and open to new ideas. Feel free to explain the 'why' behind things, offer creative alternatives, and explore tangential topics if they seem interested. They appreciate nuance and novel perspectives.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This caller prefers practical, straightforward information. Stick to concrete facts, proven approaches, and clear action steps. Avoid abstract discussions or too many options - they want the tried-and-true solution.
promptGuidance.whenMedium: Balance practical information with occasional context. Offer explanations if asked but don't over-elaborate. This caller appreciates both efficiency and understanding.
promptGuidance.promptTemplate: {{#if (gte openness 0.7)}}Feel free to explore ideas and explain underlying concepts with this curious caller.{{else if (lte openness 0.3)}}Keep it practical and concrete - this caller wants straightforward answers.{{/if}}

parameters.name: conscientiousness
parameters.description: Conscientiousness - organization, dependability, self-discipline, preference for planned behavior

definitions.high: Uses lists, sequences, categories; organizes thoughts before speaking
definitions.low: Stream of consciousness; jumps between topics; comfortable with disorder

definitions.high: Provides exact dates, numbers, names; asks clarifying questions for precision
definitions.low: Uses approximations; comfortable with 'roughly' and 'about'; less concerned with exactness

definitions.high: Discusses schedules, deadlines, goals; wants to know next steps
definitions.low: Lives in the moment; flexible with timing; resistant to firm commitments

interpretationScale.label: Flexible/Spontaneous
interpretationScale.implication: Prefers flexibility, may resist rigid processes, comfortable with ambiguity

interpretationScale.label: Balanced
interpretationScale.implication: Can work with structure but doesn't need it; adaptable

interpretationScale.label: Organized
interpretationScale.implication: Appreciates clear processes and timelines; reliable follow-through

interpretationScale.label: Highly Conscientious
interpretationScale.implication: Needs detailed plans, precise information, clear expectations

scoringAnchors.example: Yeah, whenever works. I'll figure it out as I go. Don't worry about the details.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Dismisses planning, comfortable with ambiguity, no concern for specifics

scoringAnchors.example: Sometime next week should work. Just send me the info and I'll get to it when I can.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Loose timeframes, will engage but not urgently organized about it

scoringAnchors.example: Can we schedule that for Tuesday or Wednesday? I want to make sure I have time to review everything properly.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Wants specific timing, shows planning ahead, concerned with proper process

scoringAnchors.example: I'd prefer Tuesday at 2pm specifically. Can you send me an agenda beforehand so I can prepare? And what documents should I have ready?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Precise scheduling, wants preparation materials, organized approach

scoringAnchors.example: Let me check my calendar - I have a 15-minute window at 2:15pm on Tuesday. I'll need the documentation by Monday EOD to review. Can you also send a checklist of everything I need to complete? I like to track these items systematically.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Highly precise timing, systematic tracking, detailed preparation needs

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This caller values structure and precision. Provide specific timelines, clear step-by-step processes, and detailed information. Confirm exact details and follow up on commitments precisely.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This caller prefers flexibility. Avoid overwhelming them with details or rigid timelines. Keep it high-level and let them know they can reach out when ready.
promptGuidance.whenMedium: Provide clear information without excessive detail. Offer structure but don't force rigid processes. Balance thoroughness with flexibility.
promptGuidance.promptTemplate: {{#if (gte conscientiousness 0.7)}}Provide specific details, timelines, and clear next steps for this organized caller.{{else if (lte conscientiousness 0.3)}}Keep it flexible and high-level - this caller doesn't need rigid structure.{{/if}}

parameters.name: extraversion
parameters.description: Extraversion - energy, positive emotions, assertiveness, sociability, talkativeness

definitions.high: Fast-paced speech, animated delivery, high verbal output
definitions.low: Measured pace, quieter delivery, economical with words

subMetrics.name: Social Engagement
subMetrics.description: Interest in social connection and rapport-building

definitions.high: Makes small talk, asks personal questions, shares about self
definitions.low: Stays task-focused, minimal personal disclosure, businesslike

subMetrics.name: Positive Emotionality
subMetrics.description: Expression of positive emotions and enthusiasm

definitions.high: Expresses excitement, uses enthusiastic language, laughs easily
definitions.low: Neutral tone, reserved emotional expression, serious demeanor

interpretationScale.label: Introverted
interpretationScale.implication: Prefers focused, task-oriented interaction; may find chattiness draining

interpretationScale.label: Ambivert
interpretationScale.implication: Comfortable with both social and focused interactions

interpretationScale.label: Sociable
interpretationScale.implication: Enjoys conversation and connection; appreciates friendly interaction

interpretationScale.label: Highly Extraverted
interpretationScale.implication: Energized by interaction; wants rapport and engagement

scoringAnchors.example: Yes. [pause] The policy number is 12345. [pause] What else do you need?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Minimal words, no social engagement, just the facts, long pauses

scoringAnchors.example: Hi. I'm calling about my account. I need to update my address please.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Polite but businesslike, no elaboration, efficient communication

scoringAnchors.example: Hey there! Yeah, I need to update my address - just moved last month. It's been a bit hectic but we're settling in.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Friendly opener, shares context unprompted, conversational but not excessive

scoringAnchors.example: Hi! How are you doing today? Great! So I'm calling because we just moved - it's been such an adventure! The new place is amazing. Anyway, I need to update my address with you guys.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Asks about agent, enthusiastic, shares personal details, animated

scoringAnchors.example: Hey!! Oh my gosh, I'm so glad I got through! How's your day going? I bet you talk to so many people! So listen, we just moved and I am SO excited about the new house - you would not BELIEVE the kitchen! But anyway, I'm rambling, haha! I need to update my address but first tell me, have you been busy today?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Very high energy, extensive small talk, highly animated, asks multiple personal questions

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This caller is energized by social interaction. Match their enthusiasm, engage in friendly banter, and don't rush through the conversation. They appreciate warmth and connection.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This caller prefers efficient, focused interaction. Be friendly but businesslike. Don't force small talk or expect enthusiasm - they appreciate getting things done.
promptGuidance.whenMedium: Be personable but balanced. Some friendly exchange is welcome but don't overdo it. Read their cues for how much social interaction they want.
promptGuidance.promptTemplate: {{#if (gte extraversion 0.7)}}Be warm and engaging with this sociable caller - they enjoy the interaction!{{else if (lte extraversion 0.3)}}Keep it efficient and professional - this caller prefers focused communication.{{/if}}

parameters.name: agreeableness
parameters.description: Agreeableness - cooperation, trust, empathy, tendency to be helpful and avoid conflict

subMetrics.name: Cooperation Markers
subMetrics.description: Willingness to go along, accommodate, find common ground

definitions.high: Readily agrees, looks for compromise, accommodating language
definitions.low: Questions and challenges, states opposing views, stands ground

definitions.high: Softens disagreements, uses hedging language, avoids direct confrontation
definitions.low: Comfortable with direct disagreement, challenges assertions, debates

definitions.high: Accepts information at face value, expresses trust, assumes good intent
definitions.low: Questions motives, asks for verification, skeptical of claims

interpretationScale.label: Challenging/Skeptical
interpretationScale.implication: Will question and push back; needs to be convinced; values their own judgment

interpretationScale.label: Balanced
interpretationScale.implication: Reasonably trusting but will push back when needed

interpretationScale.label: Cooperative
interpretationScale.implication: Generally trusting and agreeable; prefers harmony

interpretationScale.label: Highly Agreeable
interpretationScale.implication: Very accommodating; may not voice concerns; needs explicit invitation to disagree

scoringAnchors.example: I don't think that's right. Show me where it says that. I've been told something different before and I need to verify this myself.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Direct challenge, demands proof, explicit distrust, won't accept at face value

scoringAnchors.example: Hmm, I'm not sure about that. Can you explain why that's the case? I want to understand before I agree to anything.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Questions but not hostile, wants reasoning, cautiously skeptical

scoringAnchors.example: Oh okay, that makes sense. I wasn't sure how that worked but if that's the policy then that's fine with me.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Accepts explanation, goes along with it, mild initial uncertainty but accommodates

scoringAnchors.example: Sure, whatever you think is best. You're the expert here. I trust your recommendation.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Defers to authority, expresses trust explicitly, doesn't question

scoringAnchors.example: Oh absolutely, that sounds perfect! I'm sure you know what's best. I don't want to be difficult - whatever works for you works for me. I really appreciate you helping me with this.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Very accommodating, explicitly avoids being 'difficult', high trust, grateful

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This caller is very trusting and cooperative. Be careful not to take advantage - actively check if they have concerns and invite questions. They may not voice objections unprompted.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This caller needs to be convinced. Provide evidence and reasoning for recommendations. Don't take pushback personally - they're evaluating, not attacking. Respect their skepticism.
promptGuidance.whenMedium: Provide clear reasoning but don't over-justify. This caller will ask if they have concerns. Balance being helpful with respecting their judgment.
promptGuidance.promptTemplate: {{#if (gte agreeableness 0.7)}}Check in with this trusting caller - actively invite any concerns they might have.{{else if (lte agreeableness 0.3)}}Be ready to explain your reasoning - this caller will question and needs to be convinced.{{/if}}

parameters.name: neuroticism
parameters.description: Neuroticism - tendency to experience negative emotions, emotional reactivity, anxiety

definitions.high: Expresses worry about outcomes, asks reassurance questions, anticipates problems
definitions.low: Calm demeanor, doesn't dwell on potential problems, takes things in stride

definitions.high: Easily frustrated, expresses irritation, emotionally reactive
definitions.low: Even-keeled, doesn't express frustration easily, emotionally stable

definitions.high: Anticipates what could go wrong, asks about risks, needs reassurance
definitions.low: Focuses on positive outcomes, doesn't dwell on risks, optimistic

interpretationScale.label: Emotionally Stable
interpretationScale.implication: Calm under pressure; doesn't need much reassurance; handles stress well

interpretationScale.label: Balanced
interpretationScale.implication: Normal range of emotional reactivity; sometimes stressed but manages

interpretationScale.label: Sensitive
interpretationScale.implication: More reactive to stress; benefits from reassurance and clear information

interpretationScale.label: Anxious
interpretationScale.implication: Needs significant reassurance; sensitive to uncertainty; provide extra support

scoringAnchors.example: No worries, these things happen. Let's just figure out the best path forward.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Calm response to problem, no blame, solution-focused, emotionally even

scoringAnchors.example: Okay, that's a bit frustrating but I understand. What are my options here?
scoringAnchors.rationale: Acknowledges frustration briefly but moves on, doesn't dwell, practical

scoringAnchors.example: Oh no, that's concerning. Are you sure that's going to work? I've had bad experiences with this before and I really don't want that to happen again.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Expresses worry, references past negative experiences, seeks reassurance

scoringAnchors.example: Wait, what? This is really stressing me out. What if something goes wrong? I need you to make sure this is going to be okay because I can't handle another problem right now.
scoringAnchors.rationale: High stress expression, anticipates problems, explicit anxiety, needs reassurance

scoringAnchors.example: Oh my god, this is a disaster. I knew something like this would happen. I've been worried about this for weeks. What if it doesn't work? What if there's a mistake? I can't sleep thinking about all the things that could go wrong. Please tell me it's going to be okay.
scoringAnchors.rationale: Catastrophizing, chronic worry, extreme emotional reaction, desperate for reassurance

promptGuidance.whenHigh: This caller is anxious and needs reassurance. Acknowledge their concerns, provide clear information about what will happen, and offer explicit reassurance. Be patient with repeated questions - they need to feel secure.
promptGuidance.whenLow: This caller is emotionally stable and handles uncertainty well. You don't need to over-reassure. Be direct and matter-of-fact - they don't need extensive emotional support.
promptGuidance.whenMedium: Provide clear information and some reassurance when appropriate. Acknowledge any concerns they raise but don't assume they need extensive emotional support.
promptGuidance.promptTemplate: {{#if (gte neuroticism 0.7)}}Provide extra reassurance and be patient - this caller is anxious and needs to feel supported.{{else if (lte neuroticism 0.3)}}This caller handles stress well - be direct and efficient.{{/if}}
